job.jobDescriptionText:
Full job description
[Quora is a privately held, "remote-first" company. This position can be performed remotely from multiple countries around the world. Please visit careers.quora.com/eligible-countries for details regarding employment eligibility by country.]

About Quora:
Quora’s mission is to grow and share the world’s knowledge. To do so, we have two knowledge sharing products:

Quora: a global knowledge sharing platform with over 400M monthly unique visitors, bringing people together to share insights on various topics and providing a unique platform to learn and connect with others.

Poe: a platform providing millions of global users with one place to chat, explore and build with a wide variety of AI language models (bots), including GPT-5, Claude Sonnet 4.5, Grok 4, Veo 3, Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano Banana), and more. As AI capabilities rapidly advance, Poe provides a single platform to instantly integrate and utilize these new models.

Behind these products are passionate, collaborative, and high-performing global teams. We have a culture rooted in transparency, idea-sharing, and experimentation that allows us to celebrate success and grow together through meaningful work. Join us on this journey to create a positive impact and make a significant change in the world.

This role will be working on our Poe product.

About the Team and Role:
The Monetization team on Poe is focused on building innovative features around how users purchase access to a variety of AI language models (LLMs) on our platform through subscriptions and direct purchases, as well as how we pay our creators. Our mission is to create seamless, user-friendly experiences for both subscribers and creators, creating a sustainable marketplace that benefits both users and creators.

We are seeking a talented Full Stack Engineer to join our team in developing new monetization features for Poe. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to build critical systems that power subscriptions, direct purchases, bot pricing models, and creator monetization tools. Your work will directly impact how millions of users interact with and purchase access to various LLMs and how creators monetize their expertise and AI models on the platform.

As a senior engineer on the team, you'll collaborate closely with designers, product managers, data scientists, and other engineers to conceptualize, build, and iterate on monetization features from end to end. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with strong technical skills who wants to make a significant impact on a rapidly growing AI platform while working on challenging problems at the intersection of technology and business.

Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain robust backend and frontend systems for Poe's monetization features, including subscription management, LLM access purchasing flows, and creator payment systems

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the user-problems and translate them into scalable technical solutions

Build intuitive and elegant user interfaces for complex monetary transactions

Develop and optimize payment processing systems, ensuring security, reliability, and compliance with financial regulations

Create tools that empower creators to set pricing, monitor revenue, and understand their monetization performance

Participate in technical design reviews and contribute to architectural decisions

Mentor other engineers and contribute to engineering best practices across the organization

Minimum Requirements:
Availability for meetings and impromptu communication during Quora's “coordination hours" (Mon-Fri: 9am-3pm Pacific Time)

8+ years of professional software engineering experience, with a focus on full-stack development

Strong experience in at least one of: frontend development (React, TypeScript) or backend systems (Python)

Experience building and maintaining production systems that handle financial transactions

Solid understanding of database design, API development, and web application architecture

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, especially important when working with monetary systems

Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams

Preferred Requirements:
Passion for AI technology and creating business models that support AI innovation

Experience with payment processing systems, subscription management, or financial technology

Knowledge of financial compliance requirements and best practices for handling monetary transactions

Experience with GraphQL and modern frontend frameworks (React, NextJS)

Understanding of data analysis and metrics tracking for business and financial systems

Prior experience working on consumer-facing products with monetization components

At Quora, we value diversity and inclusivity and welcome individuals from all backgrounds, including marginalized or underrepresented groups in tech, to apply for our job openings. We encourage all candidates who share a passion for growing the world’s knowledge, even those who may not strictly meet all the preferred requirements, to apply, as we know that a diverse range of perspectives can have a significant impact on our products and our culture.

Additional Information:
We are accepting applications on an ongoing basis.

Quora offers a wide range of benefits including medical/dental/vision coverage, equity refreshers, remote work reimbursement, paid time off, employee assistance programs, and more. Benefits are country-specific and may vary. For more information on benefits, visit this link: https://www.careers.quora.com/benefits

There are many factors that will determine the starting pay, including but not limited to experience, location, education, and business needs.

US candidates only: For US based applicants, the salary range is $183,647 - $267,615 USD + equity + benefits.

Canada candidates only: For Toronto and Vancouver based applicants, the salary range is $238,776 - $278,361 CAD + equity + benefits. For all other locations in Canada, the salary range is $222,858 - $259,803 CAD + equity + benefits.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

entries.title: Self employed
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - San Francisco Bay Area · 1 yr 11 mos
entries.body:
- Built applications across enterprise software and embedded systems; worked in JavaScript, Python, and real-time system design.

## Digital Promise
 - Designed and implemented the micro-credential builder for [Digital Promise](https://digitalpromise.org/initiative/micro-credentials/)
     - Used by the NEA, National Geographic, and many other national education programs.

 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Onjects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals—playing on sports teams, traveling—without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
Full job description
[Quora is a privately held, "remote-first" company. This position can be performed remotely from multiple countries around the world. Please visit careers.quora.com/eligible-countries for details regarding employment eligibility by country.]

About Quora:
Quora’s mission is to grow and share the world’s knowledge. To do so, we have two knowledge sharing products:

Quora: a global knowledge sharing platform with over 400M monthly unique visitors, bringing people together to share insights on various topics and providing a unique platform to learn and connect with others.

Poe: a platform providing millions of global users with one place to chat, explore and build with a wide variety of AI language models (bots), including GPT-5, Claude Sonnet 4.5, Grok 4, Veo 3, Gemini 2.5 Flash Image (Nano Banana), and more. As AI capabilities rapidly advance, Poe provides a single platform to instantly integrate and utilize these new models.

Behind these products are passionate, collaborative, and high-performing global teams. We have a culture rooted in transparency, idea-sharing, and experimentation that allows us to celebrate success and grow together through meaningful work. Join us on this journey to create a positive impact and make a significant change in the world.

This role will be working on our Poe product.

About the Team and Role:
The Monetization team on Poe is focused on building innovative features around how users purchase access to a variety of AI language models (LLMs) on our platform through subscriptions and direct purchases, as well as how we pay our creators. Our mission is to create seamless, user-friendly experiences for both subscribers and creators, creating a sustainable marketplace that benefits both users and creators.

We are seeking a talented Full Stack Engineer to join our team in developing new monetization features for Poe. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to build critical systems that power subscriptions, direct purchases, bot pricing models, and creator monetization tools. Your work will directly impact how millions of users interact with and purchase access to various LLMs and how creators monetize their expertise and AI models on the platform.

As a senior engineer on the team, you'll collaborate closely with designers, product managers, data scientists, and other engineers to conceptualize, build, and iterate on monetization features from end to end. This is an excellent opportunity for someone with strong technical skills who wants to make a significant impact on a rapidly growing AI platform while working on challenging problems at the intersection of technology and business.

Responsibilities:
Design, build, and maintain robust backend and frontend systems for Poe's monetization features, including subscription management, LLM access purchasing flows, and creator payment systems

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the user-problems and translate them into scalable technical solutions

Build intuitive and elegant user interfaces for complex monetary transactions

Develop and optimize payment processing systems, ensuring security, reliability, and compliance with financial regulations

Create tools that empower creators to set pricing, monitor revenue, and understand their monetization performance

Participate in technical design reviews and contribute to architectural decisions

Mentor other engineers and contribute to engineering best practices across the organization

Minimum Requirements:
Availability for meetings and impromptu communication during Quora's “coordination hours" (Mon-Fri: 9am-3pm Pacific Time)

8+ years of professional software engineering experience, with a focus on full-stack development

Strong experience in at least one of: frontend development (React, TypeScript) or backend systems (Python)

Experience building and maintaining production systems that handle financial transactions

Solid understanding of database design, API development, and web application architecture

Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, especially important when working with monetary systems

Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams

Preferred Requirements:
Passion for AI technology and creating business models that support AI innovation

Experience with payment processing systems, subscription management, or financial technology

Knowledge of financial compliance requirements and best practices for handling monetary transactions

Experience with GraphQL and modern frontend frameworks (React, NextJS)

Understanding of data analysis and metrics tracking for business and financial systems

Prior experience working on consumer-facing products with monetization components

At Quora, we value diversity and inclusivity and welcome individuals from all backgrounds, including marginalized or underrepresented groups in tech, to apply for our job openings. We encourage all candidates who share a passion for growing the world’s knowledge, even those who may not strictly meet all the preferred requirements, to apply, as we know that a diverse range of perspectives can have a significant impact on our products and our culture.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals—playing on sports teams, traveling—without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
About the role:
Location: Remote-first (United States; BC & ON, Canada; Ireland; United Kingdom; Mexico)
Full-time 
The cash compensation for this role is tailored to align with the cost of labor in different geographic markets. We've structured the base pay ranges for this role into zones for our geographic markets, and the specific base pay within the range will be determined by the candidate’s geographic location, job-related experience, knowledge, qualifications, and skills.
United States  (all figures cited below are in USD and pertain to workers in the United States)
Zone A: $150,100 - 207,100
Zone B: $141,600 - 194,800
Zone C: $132,100 - 184,400
Canada (figures cited below are in CAD and pertain to workers in ON & BC, Canada)
CAD $171,000 - 235,600

This role is also eligible to participate in Webflow's company-wide bonus program. Target amounts are a percentage of base salary and vary by career level. Payouts are based on company performance against established financial and operational goals. 


Please visit our Careers page for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Engineering, Data Platform

As a Senior Software Engineer, Data Infrastructure, you’ll … 

Build and operate core data infrastructure across Airflow, Spark, and AWS to support both batch and streaming pipelines, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance.
Implement and extend metadata and catalog systems (e.g., OpenMetadata) to deliver capabilities like dataset discovery, lineage, and documentation — empowering data users with visibility and self-service.
Develop platform capabilities and event governance frameworks that enable consistent event instrumentation and publishing across data systems, ensuring schema integrity, quality, and compliance.
Implement secure and compliant data access and policy enforcement, leveraging IAM roles, schema registries, and automation to meet governance and residency requirements (GDPR, CCPA).
Design and operate resilient infrastructure — including VPCs, networking, high availability, and disaster recovery — with Pulumi-based automation across compute, storage, and data lake components (S3, Iceberg).
Collaborate with Analytics, ML, and Security teams to embed metadata-driven observability, enforcement, and streamlined onboarding of datasets, pipelines, and workflows into the platform.
Participate in incident response, code reviews, and design discussions, contributing to an operationally excellent and collaborative team culture.

In addition to the responsibilities outlined above, at Webflow we will support you in identifying where your interests and development opportunities lie and we'll help you incorporate them into your role.


About you:
You’ll thrive as a Senior Software Engineer if you:

5+ years of experience in data infrastructure, platform, or backend engineering, with hands-on expertise managing systems like Kafka, Spark, and Airflow.
Strong proficiency with cloud environments (compute, storage, networking, IAM) and infrastructure as code using Pulumi or Terraform.
Experience building and operating containerized workloads with Docker and Kubernetes.
Understanding of the foundations of data governance and metadata management — including schema evolution, lineage, and access control.
Familiarity with event instrumentation frameworks and governance practices, ensuring event schemas, naming conventions, and data contracts remain consistent and high-quality.
Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and observability tools, ensuring reliability and performance across distributed systems.
Strong problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
Stay curious and open to growth — actively building fluency in emerging technologies like AI to unlock creativity, accelerate progress, and amplify impact.

Bonus points if you have:

Experience contributing to or deploying data catalogs (DataHub, OpenMetadata) or schema registries.
Knowledge of privacy and compliance requirements (PII detection, residency, access audits).
Interest in applying ML/AI techniques for catalog enrichment (e.g., embedding-based search, documentation generation).
Our Core Behaviors:
Build lasting customer trust. We build trust by taking action that puts customer trust first.

Win together. We play to win, and we win as one team. Success at Webflow isn't a solo act.
Reinvent ourselves. We don't just improve what exists, we imagine what's possible.
Deliver with speed, quality, and craft. We move fast because the moment demands it, and we do so without lowering the bar.

job.jobDescriptionText:
About the role:
Location: Remote-first (United States; BC & ON, Canada; Ireland; United Kingdom; Mexico)
Full-time 
The cash compensation for this role is tailored to align with the cost of labor in different geographic markets. We've structured the base pay ranges for this role into zones for our geographic markets, and the specific base pay within the range will be determined by the candidate’s geographic location, job-related experience, knowledge, qualifications, and skills.
United States  (all figures cited below are in USD and pertain to workers in the United States)
Zone A: $150,100 - 207,100
Zone B: $141,600 - 194,800
Zone C: $132,100 - 184,400
Canada (figures cited below are in CAD and pertain to workers in ON & BC, Canada)
CAD $171,000 - 235,600

This role is also eligible to participate in Webflow's company-wide bonus program. Target amounts are a percentage of base salary and vary by career level. Payouts are based on company performance against established financial and operational goals. 


Please visit our Careers page for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Engineering, Data Platform

As a Senior Software Engineer, Data Infrastructure, you’ll … 

Build and operate core data infrastructure across Airflow, Spark, and AWS to support both batch and streaming pipelines, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance.
Implement and extend metadata and catalog systems (e.g., OpenMetadata) to deliver capabilities like dataset discovery, lineage, and documentation — empowering data users with visibility and self-service.
Develop platform capabilities and event governance frameworks that enable consistent event instrumentation and publishing across data systems, ensuring schema integrity, quality, and compliance.
Implement secure and compliant data access and policy enforcement, leveraging IAM roles, schema registries, and automation to meet governance and residency requirements (GDPR, CCPA).
Design and operate resilient infrastructure — including VPCs, networking, high availability, and disaster recovery — with Pulumi-based automation across compute, storage, and data lake components (S3, Iceberg).
Collaborate with Analytics, ML, and Security teams to embed metadata-driven observability, enforcement, and streamlined onboarding of datasets, pipelines, and workflows into the platform.
Participate in incident response, code reviews, and design discussions, contributing to an operationally excellent and collaborative team culture.

In addition to the responsibilities outlined above, at Webflow we will support you in identifying where your interests and development opportunities lie and we'll help you incorporate them into your role.


About you:
You’ll thrive as a Senior Software Engineer if you:

5+ years of experience in data infrastructure, platform, or backend engineering, with hands-on expertise managing systems like Kafka, Spark, and Airflow.
Strong proficiency with cloud environments (compute, storage, networking, IAM) and infrastructure as code using Pulumi or Terraform.
Experience building and operating containerized workloads with Docker and Kubernetes.
Understanding of the foundations of data governance and metadata management — including schema evolution, lineage, and access control.
Familiarity with event instrumentation frameworks and governance practices, ensuring event schemas, naming conventions, and data contracts remain consistent and high-quality.
Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and observability tools, ensuring reliability and performance across distributed systems.
Strong problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
Stay curious and open to growth — actively building fluency in emerging technologies like AI to unlock creativity, accelerate progress, and amplify impact.

Bonus points if you have:

Experience contributing to or deploying data catalogs (DataHub, OpenMetadata) or schema registries.
Knowledge of privacy and compliance requirements (PII detection, residency, access audits).
Interest in applying ML/AI techniques for catalog enrichment (e.g., embedding-based search, documentation generation).
Our Core Behaviors:
Build lasting customer trust. We build trust by taking action that puts customer trust first.

Win together. We play to win, and we win as one team. Success at Webflow isn't a solo act.
Reinvent ourselves. We don't just improve what exists, we imagine what's possible.
Deliver with speed, quality, and craft. We move fast because the moment demands it, and we do so without lowering the bar.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

entries.title: Self employed
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - San Francisco Bay Area · 1 yr 11 mos
entries.body:
- Built applications across enterprise software and embedded systems; worked in JavaScript, Python, and real-time system design.

## Digital Promise
 - Designed and implemented the micro-credential builder for [Digital Promise](https://digitalpromise.org/initiative/micro-credentials/)
     - Used by the NEA, National Geographic, and many other national education programs.

entries.title: BriteLite Immersive
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - 665 chestnut st, 2nd flr · 2 yrs 8 mos
entries.body:
- Design, program and maintain interactive multimedia display systems for events and permanent installations
 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Onjects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals—playing on sports teams, traveling—without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.name: closing-notes
blurbs.title: Closing Notes
blurbs.content:
Open to Senior/Staff Full-Stack roles at the app/infra boundary. I love pairing, mentoring, and raising the quality bar.
Contact: contact@joshwentworth.com
 • Portland, OR / Remote

This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Onjects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals—playing on sports teams, traveling—without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

## Senior Full-Stack & Platform Engineer
I design and ship production systems where product velocity and platform reliability meet. Recent work spans low-latency messaging, partner integrations, and shared tooling that standardizes observability and security across services.

**Primary stack**: TypeScript/React • Node.js • Python • Postgres/MySQL/Redis • Kubernetes • GCP

**Quick links**: [GitHub](https://github.com/Jdubz) • [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshwentworth/) • [Email](mailto:contact@joshwentworth.com)

*I build user-facing features on top of solid platforms—measurable reliability, happy developers, faster product cycles.*

[Source Code](https://github.com/Jdubz/blinky_time)

- **ux / ab testing** — funnels, flags, experimentation  
- **gcp / kubernetes / redis / postgres / typescript** — technology anchors

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

coverLetterContent.openingParagraph: I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Developer position at Google. Having closely followed Google's innovative work for years, particularly in cloud technologies and developer tools, I am confident that my skills and experience align perfectly with your team's needs and Google's commitment to pushing the boundaries of technology.
bodyParagraphs: As a Senior Software Engineer at Fulfil Solutions, I played a key role in scaling the platform to support automated grocery stores for major partners like DoorDash and Whole Foods. This involved architecting and delivering APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems, as well as building robust async job pipelines using BullMQ and GCP services to handle bursty demand. My experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including deploying and managing applications using Kubernetes, aligns directly with the technologies Google champions.

Prior to Fulfil Solutions, as Co-Founder & Lead Engineer at OPNA dev, I delivered custom web applications and integrations for clients including Intuit, McDonald’s, and even Google itself through the Google Partner Program. I gained valuable experience implementing featured GCP products like Dialogflow for enterprise applications, and Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company. This experience honed my ability to quickly learn and implement new technologies, a skill I believe is crucial in Google's fast-paced environment.
coverLetterContent.closingParagraph: I am eager to contribute my expertise in full-stack development, cloud technologies, and API design to Google's innovative projects. Thank you for considering my application. I have attached my resume for your review and welcome the opportunity to discuss my qualifications further.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals—playing on sports teams, traveling—without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

I design and ship production systems where product velocity and platform reliability meet. Recent work spans low-latency messaging, partner integrations, and shared tooling that standardizes observability and security across services.

job.jobDescriptionText:
Build Technology That Empowers Mental Health Care

You have a unique opportunity to join a mission-driven team dedicated to transforming access to high-quality mental health care. We are a well-funded startup, backed by leading investors like Insight Partners, Optum Ventures, and First Round Capital, and recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Health.


Our platform supports mental health providers in building thriving private practices. By giving them powerful tools to manage and grow their business, we enable them to focus on what they do best: providing exceptional care to their clients. When you join us, you won't just be writing code; you'll be directly removing barriers to mental health care for thousands of people.


What You’ll Do

In this role, you will be a key leader on a scaling team, with a significant impact on our clinical documentation features—a core part of the provider experience.


You will spend 60% of your time working full-stack across our codebase with a primary focus on frontend development.
You will dedicate 10% of your time to planning complex, multi-team projects with stakeholders, guiding execution and ensuring successful delivery.
You will own 10% of your time to the team’s technical execution, helping to set goals and refine prioritization practices.
You will use 10% of your time to mentor and uplift other software engineers.
You will go beyond your immediate team, spending 10% of your time to improve engineering practices across your domain.
How You’ll Do It

You will gain a deep empathy for our providers—understanding their workflows, their challenges, and their needs.
You will design, develop, and implement scalable features using our modern tech stack, including React, TypeScript, Python, Django, and MySQL.
You will build both provider-facing and internal tools that are critical to clinical care.
You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to conceptualize and build pragmatic solutions to complex problems.
You will ensure everything you build meets our high standards for performance, scalability, and security.
Who You Are

You have 6-10 years of experience as a software engineer with a proven history of working across the stack (with a frontend focus) and building products at scale.
You enjoy the challenge of collaborating on complex projects and guiding them to completion.
You have extensive experience with modern web technologies and frameworks.
You possess a strong understanding of accessibility (a11y) and security compliance.
You have implemented automated testing platforms and are committed to code quality.
You are proficient with Git and modern versioning workflows.
You thrive in a customer-centered development process and love collaborating closely with a cross-functional team.
You have a desire to experiment, learn from outcomes, and use research and data to inform your decisions.


What We Offer You

A Remote-First Culture: Work from anywhere in the U.S.
Comprehensive Health Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision insurance through Aetna and MetLife, with FSA and HSA plans.
Financial Wellness: 401(K) plan and financial perks through Northstar and BenefitHub.
Holistic Support: Monthly stipends for therapy, wellness, co-working spaces, and your home office.
Time Off: Flexible PTO, 12 paid holidays, 1 "Give Back" day, and comprehensive parental leave plans.
And More: Pet discount programs, a one-time home office stipend, and EAP access..

I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.
