job.jobDescriptionText:
Build Technology That Empowers Mental Health Care

You have a unique opportunity to join a mission-driven team dedicated to transforming access to high-quality mental health care. We are a well-funded startup, backed by leading investors like Insight Partners, Optum Ventures, and First Round Capital, and recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Health.


Our platform supports mental health providers in building thriving private practices. By giving them powerful tools to manage and grow their business, we enable them to focus on what they do best: providing exceptional care to their clients. When you join us, you won't just be writing code; you'll be directly removing barriers to mental health care for thousands of people.


What You’ll Do

In this role, you will be a key leader on a scaling team, with a significant impact on our clinical documentation features—a core part of the provider experience.


You will spend 60% of your time working full-stack across our codebase with a primary focus on frontend development.
You will dedicate 10% of your time to planning complex, multi-team projects with stakeholders, guiding execution and ensuring successful delivery.
You will own 10% of your time to the team’s technical execution, helping to set goals and refine prioritization practices.
You will use 10% of your time to mentor and uplift other software engineers.
You will go beyond your immediate team, spending 10% of your time to improve engineering practices across your domain.
How You’ll Do It

You will gain a deep empathy for our providers—understanding their workflows, their challenges, and their needs.
You will design, develop, and implement scalable features using our modern tech stack, including React, TypeScript, Python, Django, and MySQL.
You will build both provider-facing and internal tools that are critical to clinical care.
You will collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to conceptualize and build pragmatic solutions to complex problems.
You will ensure everything you build meets our high standards for performance, scalability, and security.
Who You Are

You have 6-10 years of experience as a software engineer with a proven history of working across the stack (with a frontend focus) and building products at scale.
You enjoy the challenge of collaborating on complex projects and guiding them to completion.
You have extensive experience with modern web technologies and frameworks.
You possess a strong understanding of accessibility (a11y) and security compliance.
You have implemented automated testing platforms and are committed to code quality.
You are proficient with Git and modern versioning workflows.
You thrive in a customer-centered development process and love collaborating closely with a cross-functional team.
You have a desire to experiment, learn from outcomes, and use research and data to inform your decisions.


What We Offer You

A Remote-First Culture: Work from anywhere in the U.S.
Comprehensive Health Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision insurance through Aetna and MetLife, with FSA and HSA plans.
Financial Wellness: 401(K) plan and financial perks through Northstar and BenefitHub.
Holistic Support: Monthly stipends for therapy, wellness, co-working spaces, and your home office.
Time Off: Flexible PTO, 12 paid holidays, 1 "Give Back" day, and comprehensive parental leave plans.
And More: Pet discount programs, a one-time home office stipend, and EAP access..

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

entries.title: Self employed
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - San Francisco Bay Area · 1 yr 11 mos
entries.body:
- Built applications across enterprise software and embedded systems; worked in JavaScript, Python, and real-time system design.

## Digital Promise
 - Designed and implemented the micro-credential builder for [Digital Promise](https://digitalpromise.org/initiative/micro-credentials/)
     - Used by the NEA, National Geographic, and many other national education programs.

entries.title: BriteLite Immersive
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - 665 chestnut st, 2nd flr · 2 yrs 8 mos
entries.body:
- Design, program and maintain interactive multimedia display systems for events and permanent installations
 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Objects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

entries.title: Madrone Studios
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn · 6 mos
entries.body:
- Wrote custom, controllable lighting and video applications for an immersive corporate venue including a 15 projector stitch.
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer
CNC Mill operator
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn · 6 yrs
entries.title: Wentworth Precision Machining

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
Company Overview
Deepgram is the leading voice AI platform for developers building speech-to-text (STT), text-to-speech (TTS) and full speech-to-speech (STS) offerings. 200,000+ developers build with Deepgram’s voice-native foundational models – accessed through APIs or as self-managed software – due to our unmatched accuracy, latency and pricing. Customers include software companies building voice products, co-sell partners working with large enterprises, and enterprises solving internal voice AI use cases. The company ended 2024 cash-flow positive with 400+ enterprise customers, 3.3x annual usage growth across the past 4 years, over 50,000 years of audio processed and over 1 trillion words transcribed. There is no organization in the world that understands voice better than Deepgram.

Company Operating Rhythm
At Deepgram, we expect an AI-first mindset—AI use and comfort aren’t optional, they’re core to how we operate, innovate, and measure performance.

Every team member who works at Deepgram is expected to actively use and experiment with advanced AI tools, and even build your own into your everyday work. We measure how effectively AI is applied to deliver results, and consistent, creative use of the latest AI capabilities is key to success here. Candidates should be comfortable adopting new models and modes quickly, integrating AI into their workflows, and continuously pushing the boundaries of what these technologies can do.

Additionally, we move at the pace of AI. Change is rapid, and you can expect your day-to-day work to evolve just as quickly. This may not be the right role if you’re not excited to experiment, adapt, think on your feet, and learn constantly, or if you’re seeking something highly prescriptive with a traditional 9-to-5.

Opportunity:

We're looking for an expert (Senior/Staff) Full Stack Engineer to build the Internal Developer Platform that powers our product and research teams. You will architect and build the web services, UIs, and APIs that empower our engineers to build, test, and deploy sophisticated AI-powered applications with ease. This role is focused on creating a cohesive, self-service environment that streamlines the entire development lifecycle, from code to production.

What You’ll Do

Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services and APIs for our internal developer platform.

Develop and manage robust data pipelines to support engineering and research workflows.

Build tooling and automation to enhance developer productivity and streamline CI/CD processes.

Collaborate with product and research teams to integrate new AI capabilities into the platform.

Ensure the reliability, performance, and scalability of the platform's backend infrastructure.

You’ll Love This Role If You

Are passionate about building intuitive developer tools and user interfaces.

Enjoy designing and implementing elegant, end-to-end developer workflows.

Love solving challenging problems by building robust backend services and APIs.

Are excited about leveraging AI to enhance developer productivity and platform capabilities.

Want to work at the intersection of software engineering, infrastructure, and AI.

It’s Important To Us That You Have

5+ years of experience in full-stack software development.

Proficiency in both front-end (e.g., React, Vue) and back-end (e.g., Python, Go, Node.js) development.

Demonstrated experience building internal developer platforms or similar developer-centric tooling.

Expertise in leveraging AI APIs or building applications on top of large language models.

Experience with containerization (Docker) and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes).

A strong understanding of CI/CD principles and building automated pipelines.

  

It Would Be Great if You Had 

Experience with Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g., Terraform, Pulumi).

Knowledge of cost optimization strategies for cloud infrastructure.

Experience contributing to open-source developer tools.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

**Stack**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

**Stack**: Python, gRPC, Docker

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

**Stack**: Docker, React, Raspberry Pi

 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Objects) for marketing initiatives.

 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

highlights: Scaled platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores, including DoorDash DashMart and Whole Foods.
Integrated partners like Amazon, DoorDash, and Uber Eats to enhance fulfillment and communication flows.
Architected APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems, operationalized with dashboards and alerts.

coverLetterContent.openingParagraph: Ever since I was a kid, I've been fascinated by stories—whether they were told through books, movies, or the intricate code behind a seamless app. So, when I saw the Full Stack Software Engineer position at Netflix, I felt like it was a chance to bring my passion for storytelling and tech together. Netflix's commitment to innovation and creativity resonates with my own journey, from building immersive experiences at Meow Wolf to scaling platforms for Fulfil Solutions.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I had the thrill of scaling our platform to power automated grocery stores, integrating with giants like Amazon and DoorDash. It was like piecing together a complex puzzle, ensuring every part worked harmoniously to deliver a seamless experience. This aligns with Netflix's mission to provide an unparalleled user experience, and I’m eager to bring my skills in API architecture and cloud infrastructure to your team.

Beyond the technical, I thrive on collaboration and creativity. My time at Meow Wolf taught me the power of cross-functional teamwork in crafting engaging user experiences. I believe this blend of technical expertise and creative problem-solving is what makes me a great fit for Netflix's Delivery Engineering team, where innovation is at the heart of everything you do.
coverLetterContent.closingParagraph: I'm genuinely excited about the possibility of contributing to Netflix's groundbreaking projects. I'd love to chat about how my experience with scalable systems and creative solutions can help push the boundaries of what's possible in streaming technology. Looking forward to the possibility of working together!

 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

### Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.

### Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

#### Dialogflow & JLL
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.

#### Dialogflow & McDonalds
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.

#### Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.

### Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

challenges: live on the air - no mistakes.
calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals—playing on sports teams, traveling—without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.title: Overview

## Senior Full-Stack & Platform Engineer
I design and ship production systems where product velocity and platform reliability meet. Recent work spans low-latency messaging, partner integrations, and shared tooling that standardizes observability and security across services.

**Primary stack**: TypeScript/React • Node.js • Python • Postgres/MySQL/Redis • Kubernetes • GCP

**Quick links**: [GitHub](https://github.com/Jdubz) • [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshwentworth/) • [Email](mailto:contact@joshwentworth.com)

*I build user-facing features on top of solid platforms—measurable reliability, happy developers, faster product cycles.*

entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - Stack: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, GCP, Grafana/Loki, Elastic. 
**Skills:** Google Cloud Platform (GCP) · Firebase · Angular.JS · GitHub · Node.js

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### order management web apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors—especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together—sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
The Role
As a Senior Frontend Engineer and one of the team's technical leads focusing on Web for Growth Acquisition, you'll help drive the strategy and vision for Acquisition, overseeing architecture, technical direction, and quality standards. You will play a pivotal leadership role—combining hands-on technical contribution with strategic influence over how the team builds scalable, performant, and impactful acquisition experiences. You'll collaborate closely with Product, Marketing, Design, and Data, contributing to shared platforms and advocating for best practices across multiple cross-functional squads.

This is a remote position, open to all US and Canada locations. 

You Will
Lead the design, implementation, and delivery of large-scale, user-facing features across the Acquisition funnel, predominately using Svelte and Node.js.
Own the technical direction, setting standards for scalability, accessibility, reliability, and maintainability across web initiatives.
Define and evolve the frontend architecture for Acquisition, including design system integration, platform capabilities, and shared component libraries that enhance developer productivity and ensure consistency across the platform
Collaborate across Marketing, Product, Design, and Data to optimize seller acquisition experiences and turn analytics insights into growth-driving features
Guide team-level experimentation, AB testing, and conversion funnel instrumentation to help optimize seller acquisition.
Oversee and improve frontend quality via code reviews, hands-on mentorship, and platform-wide infrastructure; champion high standards for technical excellence and documentation.
Participate and lead incident response, root cause analysis, and operational improvements to drive reliability and observability.
Explore and apply emerging technologies—such as AI-assisted engineering tools—to boost team velocity and product impact.
Mentor and coach junior and mid-level engineers, supporting their growth and ensuring a healthy engineering culture.
Foster a culture of inclusion, psychological safety, and high performance within the team. 
You Have
8+ years of professional experience with JavaScript/TypeScript and modern web frameworks (e.g., Svelte, React).
Expertise in designing and operating large-scale web applications and reusable component systems.
Proven experience leading complex projects and driving technical strategy and collaboration across cross-functional teams.
Deep knowledge of frontend performance, accessibility, observability, and operational excellence.
Strong development and leadership skills in component-driven architecture and design-system tooling.
Advanced communication skills and experience fostering collaboration in fast-paced environments.
Familiarity with frontend deployment pipelines, cloud infrastructure, and CI/CD practices.
Awareness of experimentation platforms (e.g., Optimizely, LaunchDarkly), A/B testing, and data-driven product optimization.
Comfortable with modern tooling: TypeScript, JavaScript, Svelte, React, Node.js, GraphQL, REST/gRPC, Storybook, Datadog, Sentry, Vite.
Curiosity for emerging technologies and a pragmatic approach to innovation. 
Even Better
Experience in SaaS or subscription-based, acquisition-focused products, with a focus on funnel optimization and growth engineering. 
Experience building and evolving shared UI libraries, frameworks, or platform-wide components.
Familiarity with data analysis, advanced SQL, and translating experimentation results into engineering outcomes.
Prior leadership in web platform or infrastructure projects supporting multiple cross functional teams.
Prior experience working with web platforms backed by 3rd party CMS.

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Full-time · Remote
entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - **Skills**: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, Grafana/Loki, Elastic, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Firebase, GitHub

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### Order Management Web Apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace Support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: Meow Wolf
entries.body:
I worked on multiple web applications, as well as their component library, and integrated with the docker system for fleet management. These applications had a complex pub/sub architecture to view who was using the installation (if logged in) and update their profile based on completing puzzles.

Stack: Docker, React, Styled Components, Bootstrap, MaterialUI, Pub/Sub

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

## Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.
**Skills**: Vanilla JS, unit testing

## Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

**Dialogflow & JLL**
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

**Dialogflow & McDonalds**
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

## Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.
**Skills**: Python, gRPC, Docker

## Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.
**Skills**: Docker, Django, Python, React, Raspberry Pi

## Driver's Benefits
The client had a massive HIPAA compliant Salesforce instance for case management. Their goal was to help gig workers, specifically drivers, obtain health care through government assistance. We helped them update their workflow to adhere to software best practices, like IAC and unit testing, while maintaining HIPAA compliance.
**Skills**: Salesforce, Java (Apex)

entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - San Francisco Bay Area · 1 yr 11 mos
entries.body:
- Built applications across enterprise software and embedded systems; worked in JavaScript, Python, and real-time system design.

## Digital Promise
 - Designed and implemented the micro-credential builder for [Digital Promise](https://digitalpromise.org/initiative/micro-credentials/)
     - Used by the National Education Association, National Geographic, and many other national education programs.
entries.title: Contractor
BriteLite Immersive
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - 665 chestnut st, 2nd flr · 2 yrs 8 mos
entries.body:
- Designed, programmed, and maintained interactive multimedia display systems for events and permanent installations.
 - Implemented tools for broadcast including many used on the red carpet for awards shows.
 - Built and maintained BSO's (Bright Shiny Objects) for marketing initiatives.
 - Clients included: Facebook, Instagram, Salesforce, Pinterest, Twitter
 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer, Javascript

## Instagram Instastop / Twitter Golden Screen
One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

**challenges**
- live on the air - no mistakes.
- calibrating color temperature for the cameras.
- the touch screens were IR grids that were sensitive to the flood lights, causing ghost touches.
- Super high pressure environment. FB / Instagram / Twitter would pay millions for their 30 second spot so it had to be perfect.

entries.title: Madrone Studios

 - Python, GLSL, Touch Designer
CNC Mill operator

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

job.jobDescriptionText:
About Us

At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company. 
We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us! 
Location: This is a Remote-Based role in the Central US. Location preference is Chicago region.
About the Department
Channel Account Managers, Account Executives, Business Development Representatives, Solution Engineers, Customer Success, and Sales Operations - all working together help our customers adopt Cloudflare and create great Internet-enabled experiences. The sales team at Cloudflare helps customers solve real, technical problems while creating the revenue streams that help the company provide free service to millions in our community.
What you'll do
We are looking for a seasoned channel sales professional to help us build out our Partnership with WWT. 
In this role, you'll activate, and operationalize WWT partner organizations to help expand Cloudflare's indirect sales reach. You will build a WWT business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner booked revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements.
As the WWT National Channel Account Manager, you will own and develop Cloudflare's  National Partner strategy and plan. You will work with partner stakeholders to build and execute business plans to drive sales enablement, technical training, demand gen initiatives, and campaigns.
Additional responsibilities will include:

Drive alignment, enablement and pipeline generation efforts for strategic national partners. 
Build and execute on partner business plans.
Manage quarterly sales output on assigned partner health metrics. 
Develop long-term strategic relationships with key partner accounts.
Manage MOU 

Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience

7+ years in Software/SaaS/Security Sales & Channel management.
3+ years of experience and a proven track record developing WWT within a SaaS model.
Understanding of cloud infrastructure ecosystem and cloud security is highly preferred.
Direct experience in recruiting, onboarding and enabling resellers/SI's.
Experience working in a fast paced environment.
Ability to travel 30-50% of the time.
Technical competence is strongly preferred

 
Compensation
Compensation may be adjusted depending on work location.

For Illinois based hires: Estimated annual salary of $270,000 - $330,000

This role is eligible to earn incentive compensation under Cloudflare's Sales Compensation Plan. The estimated annual salary range includes the on-target incentive compensation that may be attained in this role under the Sales Compensation Plan.
Equity
This role is eligible to participate in Cloudflare's equity plan.
Benefits
Cloudflare offers a complete package of benefits and programs to support you and your family.  Our benefits programs can help you pay health care expenses, support caregiving, build capital for the future and make life a little easier and fun!  The below is a description of our benefits for employees in the United States, and benefits may vary for employees based outside the U.S.
Health & Welfare Benefits

Medical/Rx Insurance
Dental Insurance
Vision Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts
Commuter Spending Accounts
Fertility & Family Forming Benefits
On-demand mental health support and Employee Assistance Program
Global Travel Medical Insurance

Financial Benefits

Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
Life & Accident Insurance
401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
Employee Stock Participation Plan

Time Off

Flexible paid time off covering vacation and sick leave
Leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical, and bereavement leave

 
 What Makes Cloudflare Special?
We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.
Project Galileo: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.
Athenian Project: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.
1.1.1.1: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.
Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!
This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.

We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.
Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities.  Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

entries.title: Fulfil Solutions
entries.body:
- Scaled the platform from stealth to powering three automated grocery stores (DoorDash DashMart, Whole Foods).
 - Integrated partners (Amazon, DoorDash, Uber Eats, Stripe, TaxJar, Twilio, SendGrid, PagerDuty, Slack) to unlock new fulfillment and comms flows. 
 - Architected & delivered APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems; operationalized with dashboards/alerts. 
 - Built async job pipelines (BullMQ / queues) and cache patterns that stabilized workloads under bursty demand. 
 - **Skills**: Angular, Node.js (TypeScript), MySQL, Redis, MongoDB, BullMQ, Pub/Sub, Kubernetes, Grafana/Loki, Elastic, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Firebase, GitHub

## Projects

### Amazon Fresh / Whole Foods
I was on the team engaged on a year-long project to build the cloud infrastructure and API to integrate with Amazon. We worked closely with Amazon's team to translate their business requirements into feasible requirements that would work with our system, which was built with a different architecture in mind. The project was a success, and now Fulfil's robotics are being implemented in whole foods across the US.

### Order Management Web Apps
My team was responsible for building and maintaining the end-user facing web (mobile) application and the kiosk application for order pickup.

### Marketplace Support
My team was responsible for integrating with marketplaces including Doordash and Uber eats. This meant communicating inventory, order status and lifecycle events, and customer support.
We used Doordash Drive for last mile delivery.

entries.title: OPNA dev
entries.notes: Imported from LinkedIn - Oakland, CA · 5 yrs 9 mos
entries.body:
- Delivered custom web apps, integrations, and internal tools for Intuit, McDonald’s, Google and others.
 - Built full-stack solutions with React, Node.js, Python; designed GCP deployments for production scale.
 - Implemented featured GCP products as part of Google’s partner program:
     - Enterprise apps on Dialogflow (natural language pipeline).
     - Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company.
 - Partnered cross-functionally to design user-focused products and streamline ops workflows.

## Clients

## Intuit
Intuit's marketing team often needed widgets implemented into their product quickly and efficiently. These widgets had to use vanilla JS as we were not allowed access to their dependency library, and had to have excellent text coverage.
**Skills**: Vanilla JS, unit testing

## Google Partner Program
The reason I got the GCP professional Developer Certificate was to qualify as a contractor in the partner program. When Google had a partner that was interested in a new product they would bring me on to implement said product into the partner's platform. This required me to quickly learn the best practices for the new product and implement it in whatever language and frameworks the partner happened to be using.

**Dialogflow & JLL**
I was brought on to create a massive microservice architecture that sat behind an NLP interface. The app was a simple chat with a bot, but could do everything from schedule corporate meetings to order take out. The most requested feature was managing facilities requests. Namely temperature control.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, App Engine, GCP, StackTrace, GraphQL, Apollo, CircleCI, React, CodeClimate

**Dialogflow & McDonalds**
I was on a team that implemented McDonald's entire menu into a chat application for customer ordering. This allowed for substitutions and order modifications, as well as coupons and special codes.
**Skills**: Dialogflow, Node, Express

## Game servers
In a multiplayer video game context you cannot simply scale containers up and down to react to load like a normal application. Game servers is a GCP product that allows you to select a set of users for a "match" and assign them to a specific instance. the container is then automatically spun up and down for the duration of the match.
**Skills**: Python, gRPC, Docker

## Bartendro
An open source cocktail mixing machine. We rebuilt the UI and implemented a containerized server that communicated with the hardware. We added observability, remote updates, remote monitoring, and cloud menu management.
**Skills**: Docker, Django, Python, React, Raspberry Pi

## Driver's Benefits
The client had a massive HIPAA compliant Salesforce instance for case management. Their goal was to help gig workers, specifically drivers, obtain health care through government assistance. We helped them update their workflow to adhere to software best practices, like IAC and unit testing, while maintaining HIPAA compliance.
**Skills**: Salesforce, Java (Apex)

One of the primary pieces I created at Britelite was a touch screen interface that pulled content from a moderated social media stream and allowed celebrities at the event to record responses live on broadcast that would then be pushed to the moderation and marketing team to re-post as contractually allowed.

blurbs.name: biography
blurbs.title: Biography
blurbs.content:
As a lifelong type 1 diabetic (diagnosed at 18 months), I’ve always had a distinct perspective on risk and responsibility. Confronting mortality so young meant learning to enjoy life and pursue goals, playing on sports teams, traveling, without compromising my ability to manage my condition. Living with continual frustrations taught me to stay calm where others might panic; I make sound decisions under pressure and handle situations appropriately.

I studied music at UCSC after being awarded the Regents Scholarship (a full ride for grades and test scores). I originally started as a dual major in Physics and Chemistry, but quickly realized that, during a period of growth and experimentation, music was more engaging than mathematics. In the electronic music program, I discovered computers as a creative medium for music, video, and interactivity. That exploration led me to build a Max/MSP program that triggered lighting and video changes based on musical events, using an adaptive listening algorithm informed by music theory. That project launched my tech career.

As I developed the tool further, I adopted TouchDesigner, extending the system with GLSL and Python. I began building installations for large social media companies, bridging the gap between their online following and live events. The goal was to create a feedback loop between celebrities and their followers (moderated by a marketing team). These experiences reinforced my ability to perform under pressure: live broadcasts that depended on my tools reached millions of viewers and allowed no delays. I had to deliver zero-tolerance software with no room for error.

Throughout my career, I’ve enjoyed applying professional skills to artistic endeavors, especially those that build community. I grew up working in my father’s CNC machine shop, and it has never occurred to me that there’s anything I can’t create (which has also led to many valuable learning opportunities). Trying, adapting, and overcoming new challenges has been part of my personality for as long as I can remember. Not knowing exactly how to do something is a powerful motivator; learning is a reward beyond the success of any single project.

Using technology to foster connection is a big part of my life. Professionally, that meant strengthening relationships between a brand and its customers, and later between users and the tools I built. In personal projects, I focused on bringing people together, sometimes by crafting fun, engaging environments, and other times by proposing playful icebreakers and ways to interact that go beyond small talk without being intrusive.

As a creative technologist and community leader, I thrive in social environments where teams work toward a common goal. I handle pressure well and even enjoy it in moderation. Wherever life leads me, I plan to keep living these ideals in both my professional and personal life.

blurbs.name: closing-notes
blurbs.title: Closing Notes
blurbs.content:
Open to Senior/Staff Full-Stack roles at the app/infra boundary. I love pairing, mentoring, and raising the quality bar.

 • Portland, OR / Remote

coverLetterContent.openingParagraph: Ever since I was a kid, I've been fascinated by the idea of building things that make life easier and more connected. It's probably why I ended up spending years tinkering with CNC machines before diving into the world of software. When I stumbled upon Cloudflare's mission to build a better Internet, it felt like a natural extension of my own journey - creating seamless, secure experiences for everyone online.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I had the chance to scale our platform from stealth mode to powering automated grocery stores for big names like DoorDash and Whole Foods. It was all about integrating partners and crafting APIs that made complex systems work together smoothly. This experience taught me the art of collaboration and strategic planning, which I see as a perfect fit for the Partner Account Manager role with WWT at Cloudflare. I love the idea of activating and operationalizing partnerships to expand sales reach - it's like solving a giant puzzle with real-world impact.

What really excites me about Cloudflare is your commitment to innovation and inclusivity. Projects like Galileo and Athenian show a dedication to protecting the free Internet, which resonates with my own values of creating open and accessible technology. I’m eager to bring my experience in channel management and SaaS sales to help drive Cloudflare’s mission forward, especially in a role that blends strategic relationship building with technical enablement.
coverLetterContent.closingParagraph: I’m genuinely excited about the possibility of joining Cloudflare and contributing to your mission. How do you see the WWT partnership evolving in the next year, and what role do you envision for the Partner Account Manager in that journey? Looking forward to the conversation!

coverLetter.closingParagraph: I am eager to contribute my expertise in full-stack development, cloud technologies, and API design to Google's innovative projects. coverLetter.openingParagraph: I am writing to express my enthusiastic interest in the Developer position at Google. Having closely followed Google's innovative work for years, particularly in cloud technologies and developer tools, I am confident that my skills and experience align perfectly with your team's needs and Google's commitment to pushing the boundaries of technology.
bodyParagraphs: As a Senior Software Engineer at Fulfil Solutions, I played a key role in scaling the platform to support automated grocery stores for major partners like DoorDash and Whole Foods. This involved architecting and delivering APIs and automation for Amazon Fresh/Whole Foods delivery systems, as well as building robust async job pipelines using BullMQ and GCP services to handle bursty demand. My experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including deploying and managing applications using Kubernetes, aligns directly with the technologies Google champions.

Prior to Fulfil Solutions, as Co-Founder & Lead Engineer at OPNA dev, I delivered custom web applications and integrations for clients including Intuit, McDonald’s, and even Google itself through the Google Partner Program. I gained valuable experience implementing featured GCP products like Dialogflow for enterprise applications, and Game Servers for a large mobile gaming company. This experience honed my ability to quickly learn and implement new technologies, a skill I believe is crucial in Google's fast-paced environment.
coverLetter.closingParagraph: I am eager to contribute my expertise in full-stack development, cloud technologies, and API design to Google's innovative projects. Thank you for considering my application. I have attached my resume for your review and welcome the opportunity to discuss my qualifications further.

coverLetter.openingParagraph: Ever since I was a kid, I've been fascinated by stories—whether they were told through books, movies, or the intricate code behind a seamless app. So, when I saw the Full Stack Software Engineer position at Netflix, I felt like it was a chance to bring my passion for storytelling and tech together. Netflix's commitment to innovation and creativity resonates with my own journey, from building immersive experiences at Meow Wolf to scaling platforms for Fulfil Solutions.
bodyParagraphs: At Fulfil Solutions, I had the thrill of scaling our platform to power automated grocery stores, integrating with giants like Amazon and DoorDash. It was like piecing together a complex puzzle, ensuring every part worked harmoniously to deliver a seamless experience. This aligns with Netflix's mission to provide an unparalleled user experience, and I’m eager to bring my skills in API architecture and cloud infrastructure to your team.

Beyond the technical, I thrive on collaboration and creativity. My time at Meow Wolf taught me the power of cross-functional teamwork in crafting engaging user experiences. I believe this blend of technical expertise and creative problem-solving is what makes me a great fit for Netflix's Delivery Engineering team, where innovation is at the heart of everything you do.
coverLetter.closingParagraph: I'm genuinely excited about the possibility of contributing to Netflix's groundbreaking projects. I'd love to chat about how my experience with scalable systems and creative solutions can help push the boundaries of what's possible in streaming technology. Looking forward to the possibility of working together!
